      None.                                     
           THIRD READING                        
         CONSENT CALENDAR                       
      None.                                     
   THIRD READING, REPORT OF                     
 THE ENGROSSMENT COMMITTEE                      
      AND FINAL PASSAGE                         
        OF BOARD BILLS                          
      None.                                     
         REPORT OF THE                          
     ENROLLMENT COMMITTEE                       
      None.                                     
      COURTESY RESOLUTIONS                      
        CONSENT CALENDAR                        
      Resolution Nos. 141-150 were adopted      
 during summer recess.                          
           Resolution No. 141                   
      WHEREAS, we pause in our                  
 deliberations to note the untimely passing of  
 Pearlie Mae Carroll on Monday, July 29, 2002;  
 and                                            
      WHEREAS, Pearlie was born on May          
 13, 1913 in Learned, Mississippi to Ebb and    
 Sweet Mae Houston; and                         
      WHEREAS, Pearlie accepted Christ as       
 a young woman at Mount Zion M.E. Church        
 and was an active and faithful member of       
 Samuel Brown Temple Church in St. Louis        
 for many years; and                            
       WHEREAS, Pearlie was sustained           
 throughout her life by the love and devotion   
 of her late husband, D. O. Carroll and her six 
 children, Charlie, Marie, Anges, J.C., Otha and
 Bennie; and                                    
      WHEREAS, Pearlie will be greatly          
 missed by her daughter Agnes Soll; her sons,   
 J,C, Carroll, Otha Mims and Bennie Carroll;    
 her sisters, Emma and Thelma; her brother,     
Virgil; her thirty-eight grand children, seventy   
great grandchildren, thirty-two great great        
grandchildren, her family and her countless        
friends and admirers;                              
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of               
the City of St. Louis, that, on behalf of the St.  
Louis community, we pause to remember the          
love and kindness of Pearlie Mae Carroll, and      
we join with her many friends in expressing        
our sorrow at her passing, and we further direct   
the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy of        
this Resolution across the minutes of these        
proceedings and to prepare a memorial copy         
for presentation to the Carroll family at a time   
and place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.       
Introduced the 2nd day of August, 2002 by:         
Honorable Freeman Bosley, Sr., Alderman 3rd Ward   
          Resolution No. 142                       
      WHEREAS, we pause in our                     
deliberations to note the untimely passing of      
our friend and former colleague, John H. Koch,     
Jr. on Sunday, August 11, 2002; and                
      WHEREAS, John was an outstanding             
public servant who began his career in St. Louis   
City government in August, 1980 when he            
was elected Alderman for the Eighth Ward;          
and                                                
      WHEREAS, after serving the residents         
of the Eighth Ward for more than ten years,        
John was selected by then Mayor Vince              
Schoemehl to lobby, on behalf of the City,         
before the Missouri General Assembly and           
the St. Louis City Board of Aldermen; and          
     WHEREAS, in January, 1995 John was            
named Zoning Administrator for the City of         
St. Louis; a position of tremendous                
responsibility which directly impacts the          
growth and development of this community           
and which requires the patience of Job and         
the wisdom of Solomon; and                         
     WHEREAS , John dedicated more than            
twenty years of his life to the City of St.        
Louis and his commitment, resourcefulness,         
experience and friendship will not be forgotten;   
and                                                
      WHEREAS, John will be greatly missed         
by his wife Margaret; his daughter Jesse; his      
father John H. Koch, Sr.; his brother James;       
and his countless friends and admirers;            
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of               
the City of St. Louis, that, on behalf of the St.  
Louis community, we pause to remember the          
dedication and service of John H. Koch, Jr. to     
the City of St. Louis and the State of Missouri,   
and we join with his many friends in               
expressing our sorrow at his passing, and we       
further direct the Clerk of this Board to spread   
 a copy of this Resolution across the minutes       
 of these proceedings and to prepare a memorial     
 copy for presentation to the Koch family at a      
 time and place deemed appropriate by the           
 Sponsor.                                           
 Introduced the 14th day of August, 2002 by:        
 Honorable Freeman Bosley, Sr., Alderman 3rd Ward   
            Resolution No. 143                      
      WHEREAS, we pause in our                      
 deliberations to note the untimely passing of      
 Gilbert Wade Granberry on Thursday, August         
 8, 2002; and                                       
       WHEREAS, Mr. Granberry was born              
 and raised in Forest City, Arkansas and moved      
 to St. Louis in 1930 to work for his uncle,        
 Walter Wade, the founder of Wade Funeral           
 Home; and                                          
        WHEREAS, after his honorable                
 discharge from the United States Navy at the       
 end of World War II, Mr. Granberry returned        
 to St. Louis and eventually purchase the Wade      
 Funeral Home business from his aunt; and           
       WHEREAS, under Mr. Granberry's               
 astute leadership the Wade Funeral Home            
 expanded in the St. Louis area and is today        
 one of the largest African-American funeral        
 homes in the State of Missouri; and                
      WHEREAS , throughout his life, Mr.            
 Granberry was an active and committed              
 member of the St. Louis community. He was          
 a founding member of the Central West End          
 Bank, a deacon at the First Baptist Church in      
 St. Louis, a member of the National Funeral        
 Directors Association, a 33rd degree Mason         
 and member of the Medinah Temple No. 39            
 and an auxiliary police officer for the City of    
 Kinloch; and                                       
       WHEREAS, Mr. Granberry will be               
 greatly missed by his wife Edythe A.               
 Granberry; his daughter Joan; his stepchildren,    
 Pamela and Myron; his four grandchildren;          
 his twin sister, Garnette and his countless        
 friends and admirers;                              
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of               
 the City of St. Louis, that, on behalf of the St.  
 Louis community, we pause to remember              
 Gilbert Wade Granberry, and we join with his       
 many friends in expressing our sorrow at his       
 passing, and we further direct the Clerk of        
 this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution     
 across the minutes of these proceedings and        
 to prepare a memorial copy for presentation        
 to the Granberry family at a time and place        
 deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.                 
 Introduced the 15th day of August, 2002 by:        
 Honorable Terry Kennedy, Alderman 18th Ward        
            Resolution No. 144                    
       WHEREAS, on Thursday, August 29,           
 2002, Safety Officer Willie L. Bunton will       
 receive a Superior Performance Award from        
 the St. Louis Public School System for his       
 exemplary work performance for the 2001-         
 2002 school year while assigned to Vashon        
 High School; and                                 
       WHEREAS, Officer Bunton was hired          
 by the St. Louis Public School's Security        
 Division on August 25, 1997, as a temporary      
 Safety Officer. He was assigned to several       
 schools, including Adult Basic Education,        
 Beaumont High School and Scruggs                 
 Elementary where he began to show an earnest     
 desire to ensure that an environment existed     
 in school which was both safe and conducive      
 for learning and teaching; and                   
       WHEREAS, on August, 23, 1999,              
 Officer Bunton was promoted to permanent         
 Safety Officer and was assigned to Sumner        
 High School where he earned the position of      
 lead officer as a result of his unique leadership
 abilities. He was vital to the safety and welfare
 of students, staff and visitors who entered      
 Sumner High School. He was diligent in his       
 efforts to ensure that safety procedures were    
 carried out in a professional manner. Officer    
 Bunton received several awards at Sumner         
 High School, including an award for the most     
 drug related arrests in a school year.; and      
       WHEREAS , Officer Bunton's tactful         
 leadership, compassion and understanding         
 have been a tremendous help to the students,     
 administration and staff at Vashon High          
 School. When Officer Bunton responds to a        
 call he handles the incident with respect and    
 patience. Throughout his assignment at           
 Vashon High School he has consistently           
 demonstrated a conscientious and genuine         
 commitment to a safe and drug-free school;       
 and                                              
       WHEREAS, the St. Louis Public              
 School's Security Division's motto               
 is"Whatever it Takes" and Officer Bunton has     
 demonstrated his commitment to this creed in     
 the initiative and attention to detail which he  
 displays in his performance;                     
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our       
 deliberations to recognize and congratulate      
 Safety Officer Willie L. Bunton and we thank     
 him for his outstanding commitment to the        
 safety and well being of our children and we     
 further direct the Clerk of this Board to spread 
 a copy of this Resolution across the minutes     
 of these proceedings and to prepare a            
 commemorative copy to the end that it may        
 be presented to our honoree at a time and        
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.         
Introduced the 23rd day of August, 2002 by:       
Honorable Michael McMillan, Alderman 19th Ward    
          Resolution No. 145                      
     WHEREAS, we have been apprised that          
on August 23, 2002, Mary Bolden will              
celebrate her glorious 101st Birthday; and        
      WHEREAS, Mary was born and raised           
in Jackson, Mississippi, one of twelve children   
born to Miles and Bell Williams, and spent        
most of her life working in the cotton fields;    
and                                               
     WHEREAS , after spending her first           
ninety-seven years in Mississippi, Mary           
moved to the City of St. Louis to live with her   
niece Ada Truss; and                              
      WHEREAS, Mary is an active member           
of her church, a long time registered voter and   
a staunch member of the Democratic Party;         
and                                               
      WHEREAS, as she approaches her 101st        
birthday, Mary continues to enjoy gardening,      
watching the St. Louis Cardinals on television    
and partaking in the occasional Anheuser-         
Busch product;                                    
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our        
deliberations to congratulate Mary Bolden on      
the occasion of her 101st Birthday and we         
wish her continued peace, good health and         
happiness and we further direct the Clerk of      
this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution    
across the minutes of these proceedings and       
to prepare a commemorative copy to the end        
that it may be presented to our honoree at a      
time and place deemed appropriate by the          
Sponsor.                                          
Introduced the 21st day of August, 2002 by:       
Honorable Freeman Bosley, Alderman 3rd Ward       
          Resolution No. 146                      
      WHEREAS, we have been apprised that         
Dr. Larry E. Fields, former Director of the St.   
Louis City Department of Health and the           
current Director of Connectcare has been          
appointed to the position of Senior Executive     
Advisor to the Assistant Secretary for Health     
at the United States Department of Health         
and Human Services; and                           
      WHEREAS, during his years as Chief          
Health Officer for the City of St. Louis Dr.      
Fields devoted himself to improving the           
quality of health care available to our citizens  
and was a strong advocate for greater public      
awareness of health issues; and                   
     WHEREAS, as Director of Connectcare          
Dr. Fields dedicated his many talents to the      
members of this community who are without         
 access to adequate health care and his             
 outstanding effort on their behalf will be         
 greatly missed; and                                
       WHEREAS , Dr. Fields is an unselfish         
 health care administrator and an exemplary         
 public servant who will bring an enlightened       
 perspective to health care issues facing the       
 federal government; and                            
       WHEREAS, Dr. Fields is an exceptional        
 member of our community whose service to           
 this City and to all of our citizens is greatly    
 appreciated;                                       
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of               
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our         
 deliberations to recognize and thank Dr. Larry     
 E. Fields for his many contributions to public     
 health in the City of St. Louis and we wish        
 him continued success as he assumes his new        
 responsibilities and we further direct the Clerk   
 of this Board to spread a copy of this             
 Resolution across the minutes of these             
 proceedings and to prepare a commemorative         
 copy to the end that it may be presented to        
 our honoree at a time and place deemed             
 appropriate by the Sponsor.                        
 Introduced the 30th day of August, 2002 by:        
 Honorable Gregory Carter, Alderman 27th Ward       
 Honorable Freeman Bosley, Alderman 3rd Ward        
 Honorable Lyda Krewson, Alderwoman 28th Ward       
 Honorable Craig Schmid, Alderman 10th Ward         
 Honorable Irene Smith, Alderwoman 1 st Ward        
 Honorable Dionne Flowers, Alderwoman 2 nd Ward     
 Honorable Peggy Ryan, Alderwoman 4 th Ward         
 Honorable April Ford-Griffin, Alderwoman 5th Ward  
 Honorable Lewis Reed, Alderman 6th Ward            
 Honorable Phyllis Young, Alderwoman 7 th Ward      
 Honorable Stephen Conway, Alderman 8 th Ward       
 Honorable Kenneth Ortmann, Alderman 9 th Ward      
 Honorable Craig Schmid, Alderman 10th Ward         
 Honorable Matthew Villa, Alderman 11th Ward        
 Honorable Fred Heitert, Alderman 12th Ward         
 Honorable Fred Wessels, Alderman 13th Ward         
 Honorable Stephen Gregali, Alderman 14th Ward      
 Honorable Jennifer Florida, Alderwoman 15th Ward   
 Honorable James Shrewsbury, Alderman 16th Ward     
 Honorable Joseph Roddy, Alderman 17th Ward         
 Honorable Terry Kennedy, Alderman 18th Ward        
 Honorable Michael McMillan, Alderman 19th Ward     
 Honorable Sharon Tyus, Alderwoman 20th Ward        
 Honorable Melinda Long, Alderwoman 21st Ward       
 Honorable Daniel Kirner, Alderman 25th Ward        
 Honorable Irving Clay, Alderman 26th Ward          
            Resolution No. 147                      
       WHEREAS, we have been apprised that          
 after more than 35 years of dedicated service      
 to the City of St. Louis as a member of the St.    
 Louis Fire Department, Captain William M.          
 Rudden will retire on October 4, 2002; and         
      WHEREAS, Captain Rudden was born           
 and raised in St. Louis and is a distinguished  
 graduate of St. Anthony of Padua Elementary     
 School and Cleveland High School; and           
      WHEREAS, Captain Rudden joined the         
 St. Louis Fire Department in October, 1967      
 has served in a variety of capacities including 
 an inspector for the Fire Marshall; and         
      WHEREAS , in 1985, as a result of his      
 outstanding service and excellent skills,       
 Firefighter Rudden was promoted to the rank     
 of Captain; and                                 
      WHEREAS, Captain Rudden is an              
 outstanding public servant and his              
 professionalism, commitment and devotion to     
 duty will be greatly missed; and                
       WHEREAS , we are certain that Captain     
 Rudden is looking forward to a well deserved    
 retirement with his son, William; his family    
 and his many friends;                           
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our      
 deliberations to recognize Captain William M.   
 Rudden on the occasion of his retirement and    
 we thank him, on behalf of the citizens of the  
 City of St. Louis, for 35 years of outstanding  
 service to this community and we wish him       
 peace, good health and happiness in his         
 retirement and we direct the Clerk of this Board
 to spread a copy of this Resolution across the  
 minutes of these proceedings and to further     
 prepare a commemorative copy to the end         
 that it may be presented to our honoree at a    
 time and place deemed appropriate by the        
 Sponsor.                                        
 Introduced the 3rd day of September, 2002       
 by:                                             
 Honorable Alfred Wessels, Alderman 13th Ward    
           Resolution No. 148                    
      WHEREAS, recently, members of the          
 St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department        
 and the St. Louis Fire Department participated  
 in NBC's "Today's Bravest and Finest"           
 competition in New York City; and               
      WHEREAS, this competition brought          
 together four person teams of firefighters and  
 police officers from around the country to      
 compete against each other on a unique          
 obstacle course constructed at Rockefeller      
 Center; and                                     
      WHEREAS, the outstanding St. Louis         
 team was comprised of Battalion Chief           
 Douglas Cribbs, Firefighter Keith Williams and  
 Police Officers Sam Hill and Kathleen Nocito;   
 and                                             
     WHEREAS , after defeating teams from         
Phoenix, Arizona and Philadelphia,                
Pennsylvania, Team St. Louis prevailed in the     
finals over the team from Worcester,              
Massachusetts in a race which was                 
determined in the final seconds of the            
competition; and                                  
      WHEREAS, as a result of this                
tremendous team effort and great victory, the     
St. Louis Backstoppers organization received      
a donation of $30,000 from NBC; and               
      WHEREAS, in addition to being               
dedicated civil servants, the victorious          
members of Team St. Louis have proven             
themselves to be invaluable ambassadors for       
this City;                                        
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our        
deliberations to congratulate Police Officers     
Kathleen Nocito and Sam Hill, Battalion Chief     
Douglas Cribbs and Firefighter Keith Williams     
for their outstanding victory in Today's          
"Bravest and Finest" competition and we           
thank them for their exemplary service to the     
citizens of the City of St. Louis and we further  
direct the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy   
of this Resolution across the minutes of these    
proceedings and to prepare a commemorative        
copy to the end that it may be presented to       
our honorees at a time and place deemed           
appropriate by the Sponsor.                       
Introduced the 30th day of August, 2002 by:       
Honorable Stephen Gregali, Alderman 14th Ward     
          Resolution No. 149                      
      WHEREAS , the unprovoked attacks of         
September 11, 2001, upon America by foreign       
terrorists have thrust the United States, and     
other countries, into a war it never envisioned,  
militarily or diplomatically; and                 
      WHEREAS , challenges facing all the         
civilized people of the world as they relate to   
the war of terrorism will not end until those     
fanatics responsible are eliminated or brought    
to justice; and                                   
     WHEREAS , America is fully committed         
through Operation Enduring Freedom and            
Operation Noble Eagle to ensure our freedoms      
remain unfettered and sovereign for all           
generations, now and forever; and                 
     WHEREAS , world opinion needs to             
remain focused upon the eradication of these      
inhuman acts perpetrated around the globe;        
and                                               
     WHEREAS , one way to accomplish              
this is to NEVER FORGET that those                
innocent victims did not die in vain; and         
       WHEREAS , America can fight back by         
 reminding the world that the deaths of these      
 people will always be remembered and they         
 will be forever loved; and                        
      WHEREAS, a noble and appropriate             
 way to accomplish this is through the annual      
 celebration of their living; and                  
       WHEREAS , this commemoration                
 should be held each September 11 throughout       
 the land to include:                              
 The promotion of global peace and goodwill;       
 The demonstration of America's resolve and        
 perseverance to win the war on terrorism;         
 The advancement of responsible citizenship;       
 The encouragement of patriotism and love of       
 country; and                                      
 The poignant remembrance of those innocent        
 victims that died on September 11, as heroes      
 , on and all;                                     
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
 the City of St. Louis that this resolution be     
 issued to memorialize those men, women and        
 children who lost their lives; and be it further  
 resolved that his resolution be publicized for    
 all to see and know that the citizens of the      
 City of St. Louis remember with eternal respect   
 those whose lives were suddenly, without          
 cause, and pointlessly taken from them on         
 September 11, 2001. MAY THEY                      
 FOREVER REST IN PEACE AND ABIDE                   
 IN OUR MEMORIES. We further direct the            
 Clerk of this Board to spread a copy of this      
 Resolution across the minutes of these            
 proceedings and to prepare a commemorative        
 copy to the end that it may be presented to       
 our honorees at a time and place deemed           
 appropriate by the Sponsor.                       
 Introduced on the 2nd day of September, 2002      
 by:                                               
 Honorable James Shrewsbury, Alderman 16th Ward    
            Resolution No. 150                     
      WHEREAS , we have been advised that          
 on September 6, 2002, long-time city resident     
 Thomas E. Eichhorst, J. D., will retire from      
 the American Optometric Association whose         
 national headquarters is located in the           
 metropolitan St. Louis area; and                  
       WHEREAS , Mr. Eichhorst was first           
 employed by the American Optometric               
 Association in October 1965 and has served        
 the Association as Counsel and as Director of     
 the State Government Relations Center for         
 thirty-seven years; and                           
      WHEREAS , Mr. Eichhorst has made             
 contributions to the advancement of the           
 Association and the profession that will far   
 outlast his years of service; and              
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                      
 RESOLVED by the St. Louis Board of             
 Aldermen, being apprised of the significant    
 recognition of the important role Mr. Eichhorst
 has played in the legislative advancement of   
 the profession of optometry, his dedication    
 and commitment to the Association, and his     
 active participation in many local worthwhile  
 community activities, we send Mr. Eichhorst    
 our congratulations for an outstanding career  
 with the American Optometric Association       
 and best wishes for his retirement and future  
 endeavors as we pause in our deliberations to  
 consider and adopt this resolution, and        
 instruct the Clerk of this Board to spread a   
 copy of this resolution over the permanent     
 rolls of the Board and to further prepare a    
 memorial copy of this resolution so that it    
 may be presented to our honoree as deemed      
 appropriate by the Sponsor.                    
 Introduced on the 2nd day of September, 2002   
 by:                                            
 Honorable James Shrewsbury, Alderman 16th Ward 
      Mr. Shrewsbury introduced Resolution      
 Nos. 151, 152, 155, 156, 158, 159 and 160      
 and the Clerk was instructed to read same.     
           Resolution No. 151                   
       WHEREAS, we have been advised that       
 on September 29, 2002 the rank of Eagle Scout  
 will be awarded to Nicolas Carretero; and      
      WHEREAS, Nicolas is the son of            
 Joseph and Jackie Carretero, who are both      
 proud and happy to announce this               
 momentous accomplishment in Nicolas' life;     
 and                                            
      WHEREAS, Nicolas has dedicated            
 himself to the hard work and commitment of     
 the Scouting program without forgetting the    
 importance of his education; and               
       WHEREAS, those who are familiar with     
 Scouting are aware that the rank of Eagle Scout
 is a goal sought by many but attained by few;  
 requiring intelligence, perseverance, and a    
 strong sense of service to your community;     
 and                                            
       WHEREAS, Nicolas is a role model for     
 all of the younger scouts in Troop 800 and     
 will be honored by them, along with his family 
 and many friends, at the Eagle Scout Court of  
 Honor to be held on September 29, 2002 at      
 St. Timothy Catholic Church;                   
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of           
 the City of St. Louis, being apprised of the   
 significant recognition to be bestowed on      
 Nicolas Carretero at the Eagle Court of Honor, 
and wishing in some small way to add our         
congratulations and best wishes to Nicolas       
and his family, we pause in our deliberations    
to consider and adopt this resolution, and       
instruct the Clerk of this Board to spread a     
copy of this resolution over the permanent       
rolls of the Board and to further prepare a      
memorial copy of this resolution so that it      
may be presented to our honoree as deemed        
appropriate by the resolution's sponsor.         
Introduced this 13th day of September, 2002      
by:                                              
Honorable Fred Heitert, Alderman 12th Ward       
          Resolution No. 152                     
      WHEREAS, we have been apprised that        
after more than thirty-eight years of dedicated  
service to the City of St. Louis Ida B. Menley   
will retire on September 27, 2002; and           
      WHEREAS, Ida began her service to the      
citizens of the City of St. Louis on December    
28, 1967; and                                    
      WHEREAS, for the last thirty-eight         
years Ida has worked for a variety of city       
offices including City Hospital, Koch            
Hospital, Kiel Center, Truman Center, the        
Board of Public Service and Lambert-St. Louis    
International Airport and her expertise and      
professionalism will be greatly missed; and      
     WHEREAS , in addition to her devotion       
to her family and career, Ida is an devoted      
member of the New View Holiness Church of        
God where she serves as Chief Usher and          
Sunday School Superintendent; and                
     WHEREAS, we are certain that Ida is         
looking forward to a well deserved retirement    
with her son, her grandchild, her five great     
grandchildren and her many friends;              
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our       
deliberations to congratulate Ida B. Menley      
for thirty-four years of outstanding service to  
the City of St. Louis and we wish her peace      
and happiness in her retirement and we direct    
the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy of      
this Resolution across the minutes of these      
proceedings and to further prepare a             
commemorative copy to the end that it may        
be presented to our honoree at a time and        
place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.         
Introduced on the 13th day of September,         
2002 by:                                         
Honorable Gregory Carter, Alderman 27th Ward     
          Resolution No. 155                     
      WHEREAS, we have been apprised that        
September 8, 2002 marks the 30th Anniversary     
of the opening of Blueberry Hill Restaurant      
and Bar, a St. Louis landmark; and               
      WHEREAS, in 1972, during an uncertain       
 time for the local economy and the area          
 commonly known as the Delmar Loop                
 Neighborhood, entrepreneur Joe Edwards           
 opened a new restaurant at 6504 Delmar           
 Boulevard; and                                   
       WHEREAS, through hard work and a           
 commitment to quality food and service,          
 Blueberry Hill became a model of success         
 which stabilized the neighborhood and            
 encouraged others to open new businesses in      
 the area; and                                    
      WHEREAS , thanks to the vision of Joe       
 Edwards and the many dedicated business          
 owners and residents in the area, the Delmar     
 Loop has experienced a level of growth and       
 development unimaginable in 1972; and            
       WHEREAS, Blueberry Hill Restaurant         
 and Bar is a nationally recognized St. Louis     
 institution which will forever be associated     
 with the success of the Delmar Loop              
 Neighborhood;                                    
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our       
 deliberations to recognize Joe Edwards and       
 the staff, both past and present, of Blueberry   
 Hill Restaurant and Bar for thirty years of      
 commitment and service to the citizens of the    
 City of St. Louis and we further direct the      
 Clerk of this Board to spread a copy of this     
 Resolution across the minutes of these           
 proceedings and to prepare a commemorative       
 copy to the end that it may be presented to      
 our honorees at a time and place deemed          
 appropriate by the Sponsor.                      
 Introduced on the 3rd day of September, 2002     
 by:                                              
 Honorable Lyda Krewson, Alderwoman 28th Ward     
           Resolution No. 156                     
       WHEREAS, we have been apprised that        
 after thirty-seven years of dedicated service    
 to the City of St. Louis with the St. Louis      
 Metropolitan Police Department, Lieutenant       
 Charles R. Steele retired on September 3, 2002;  
 and                                              
        WHEREAS, Lieutenant Steele began his      
 career with the St. Louis Metropolitan Police    
 Department on October 25, 1965 as a              
 probationary police officer and received his     
 first assignment as a commissioned officer on    
 April 25, 1966; and                              
       WHEREAS, during his outstanding            
 career Lieutenant Steele held various            
 assignments with the Department including        
 service in the Third District, Fourth District,  
 Fifth District, Eighth District and the Traffic  
 Safety Division; and                             
      WHEREAS, during his many years of          
 dedicated service Lieutenant Steele was the     
 recipient of numerous department citations      
 including the "Meritorious Service Award" in    
 1992; and                                       
      WHEREAS, Lieutenant Steele's               
 investigative skills, professionalism, integrity
 and sincere friendship have earned him the      
 respect and admiration of his fellow officers   
 and co-workers; and                             
      WHEREAS, Lieutenant Steele is looking      
 forward to a well deserved retirement with      
 his wife, Linda, his family and his many        
 friends;                                        
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our      
 deliberations to congratulate Lieutenant        
 Charles R. Steele for his thirty-seven years of 
 commitment and loyalty to the citizens of the   
 City of St. Louis and we wish him peace and     
 happiness in his retirement and we further      
 direct the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy 
 of this Resolution across the minutes of these  
 proceedings and to prepare a commemorative      
 copy to the end that it may be presented to     
 our honoree at a time and place deemed          
 appropriate by the Sponsor.                     
 Introduced on the 13th day of September, 2002   
 by:                                             
 Honorable Peggy Ryan, Alderman 4th Ward         
           Resolution No. 158                    
      WHEREAS, on Saturday, September 14,        
 2002, the Mark Twain Community Alliance         
 will celebrate its 34th Anniversary with a      
 Luncheon at St. Simon Cyrene Catholic           
 Church; and                                     
      WHEREAS , the Mark Twain                   
 Community Alliance has faithfully worked in     
 the Mark Twain Neighborhood for thirty-four     
 years; and                                      
      WHEREAS , the Mark Twain                   
 Community Alliance has served as a sponsor      
 of the Summer Youth Program since 1976          
 where over 1,000 summer jobs have been          
 provided to City youths aged 14-21and over      
 50 adults who have trained and supervised       
 them; and                                       
      WHEREAS , the Mark Twain                   
 Community Alliance has participated in          
 countless beautification projects, Operation    
 Brightside, Neighborhood Watch, National        
 Night Out, Spirit of Wal Mark Resettlement      
 Council; and holds regular monthly              
 community meetings; and                         
    WHEREAS , the Mark Twain                     
 Community Alliance continues to work for        
 community improvement and assist residents      
in the Mark Twain Neighborhood and               
surrounding area with home improvement and       
overall community stabilization;                 
     NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our       
deliberation to join with the Missouri           
Legislature in recognizing and honoring Mark     
Twain Community Alliance for its many            
contributions to the Mark Twain Community        
and surrounding neighborhoods and we             
congratulate it as it celebrates Thirty-four     
years of community service and urge all to       
follow Mark Twain Community Alliance's           
example and get involved in your community.      
We further direct the Clerk of this Board to     
spread a copy of this Resolution across the      
minutes of these proceedings and to prepare a    
commemorative copy to the end that it may        
be presented to our honoree at a time and        
place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.         
Introduced on the 13th day of September, 2002    
by:                                              
Honorable Irene Smith, Alderwoman 1st Ward       
          Resolution No. 159                     
     WHEREAS, St. Peter Claver was born          
in Verdu Spain in 1581 to noble and well-to-     
do parents. When he was twenty years old         
he entered the Society of Jesus and was sent     
to a House of the Society in Majorca where       
he met a humble Jesuit Lay Brother who was       
renowned for the Holiness of his life; and       
     WHEREAS, in 1610 Peter left Spain           
for Cartagena, Colombia where he was             
ordained in 1615; and                            
      WHEREAS, Cartagena, Colombia,              
South America was a port that was part of the    
"Middle Passage" of the Slave Trade and was      
the greatest slave-market in the Americas with   
thousands of slaves, who had been bought in      
West Africa, arriving each month; and            
     WHEREAS, Peter Claver resolved to           
make himself "The Slave of the Negroes           
Forever"; and                                    
      WHEREAS, the conditions on board the       
slave ships, and in the pen on shore into which  
the slaves were driven like cattle, were         
revolting beyond description, and even the       
most zealous and dedicated Missionaries could    
never accustom themselves to this work; and      
      WHEREAS, Peter spent 40 years in           
Cartagena and enlisted a number of his           
assistants to beg for alms with which he bought  
food and medicine, brandy and tobacco; and       
      WHEREAS, whenever a slave ship             
arrived he went among the slave-pens,            
distributing his gifts, caring for the sick,     
ministering to the Souls of all and with         
 interpreters he taught the slaves, telling them   
 of their value and dignity in the sight of God,   
 explaining the faith to them, preparing them      
 for baptism; and                                  
      WHEREAS, Peter died on September             
 8, 1654 and is remembered by the Church on        
 September 9th each year as the Patron Saint of    
 all Negro Missions; and                           
       WHEREAS , The Knights & Ladies of           
 Peter Claver, Junior Knights and Junior           
 Daughters founded in 1909, 1926, 1917, and        
 1930 respectively involves the entire family      
 and provides social and intellectual fellowship   
 for its members as well as proper guidance        
 and participation in the ever changing structure  
 of our social and economic life, through this     
 outstanding Catholic lay organization;            
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
 RESOLVED, by the Board of Aldermen for            
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our        
 deliberations to recognize and honor The St.      
 Louis Central Committee of the Knights &          
 Ladies of Peter Claver, Junior Knights and        
 Junior Daughters on the occasion of the feast     
 of St. Peter Claver and we direct the Clerk of    
 this Board to spread this resolution over the     
 rolls of this Board and to prepare a fitting      
 copy to be presented our honorees at a time       
 deemed appropriate by the sponsor of this         
 resolution.                                       
 Introduced this 6th day of September, 2002        
 by:                                               
 Honorable Melinda Long, Alderwoman 21st Ward      
            Resolution No. 160                     
      WHEREAS, we pause in our                     
 deliberations to note the untimely passing of     
 prominent St. Louisan, Alfred H. Kerth III,       
 on Wednesday, September 11, 2002; and             
       WHEREAS, Mr. Kerth was born and             
 raised in St. Louis and was a graduate of the     
 University of Missouri-St. Louis; and             
       WHEREAS, after a distinguished career       
 with Centerre Bank, Mr. Kerth joined the          
 Fleishman-Hillard public relations firm where     
 he became an essential part of the growth and     
 development of the St. Louis business             
 community; and                                    
       WHEREAS, since June 1998 Mr. Kerth          
 had devoted his time and considerable talents     
 to the Eads Center providing strategic planning   
 and counsel on civic issues to community          
 based organizations in the metropolitan area;     
 and                                               
      WHEREAS, Mr. Kerth was instrumental          
 in the development of the Edward Jones            
 Stadium and the Savvis Center and played a        
 key role in the relocation of the Los Angeles     
 Rams to the City of St. Louis; and                
       WHEREAS , Mr. Kerth was a founding         
 member of Confluence St. Louis (now Focus        
 St. Louis) and actively involved wth Laumeier    
 Sculpture Park, the United Way of Greater        
 St. Louis, the Salvation Army, the St. Louis     
 Science Center and the World Agricultural        
 Forum; and                                       
       WHEREAS, Mr. Kerth was a trusted           
 community leader whose vision and counsel        
 will be greatly missed throughout the St. Louis  
 region; and                                      
      WHEREAS, Mr. Kerth will be greatly          
 missed by his wife, Susan; his sons, Andrew,     
 Joseph and Daniel; his sister, Lisa Kerth        
 Roberts; his brother, Peter Kerth; his family    
 and his countless friends and admirers;          
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis, that, on behalf of the St.
 Louis community, we pause to remember the        
 dedication and commitment of Alfred H. Kerth     
 III, and we join with his many friends in        
 expressing our sorrow at his passing, and we     
 further direct the Clerk of this Board to spread 
 a copy of this Resolution across the minutes     
 of these proceedings and to prepare a memorial   
 copy for presentation to the Kerth family at a   
 time and place deemed appropriate by the         
 Sponsor.                                         
 Introduced on the 13th day of September, 2002    
 by:                                              
 Honorable Phyllis Young, Alderwoman 7th Ward     
      Unanimous consent having been               
 obtained Resolution Nos. 151, 152, 155, 156,     
 158, 159, and 160 stood considered.              
      Mr. Shrewsbury moved that Resolution        
 Nos. 151, 152, 155, 156, 158, 159 and 160 be     
 adopted, at this meeting of the Board.           
      Seconded by Mr. Wessels.                    
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.          
             FIRST READING                        
            OF RESOLUTIONS                        
      Ms. Griffin introduced Resolution No.       
 153 and requested that it be assigned to the     
 committee on Housing, Urban Development          
 & Zoning for hearing.                            
            Resolution No. 153                    
       WHEREAS , by Ordinance No. 58880,          
 this St. Louis Board of Aldermen (the "Board")   
 authorized the Mayor, on behalf of the City      
 of St. Louis (the "City"), to request the        
 designation of a certain area of the City, as    
 more fully described in said ordinance (the      
 "Initial Area") as an enterprise zone eligible   
 for the tax incentives provided in Sections      
 135.200 through 135.256, inclusive, R.S.MO.      
 (1994) (the "Statute"); and                      
      WHEREAS , BY Ordinance No. 62886            
repealing in part and restating in part           
Ordinance No. 58880, this Board authorized        
the Mayor, on behalf of the City, to request      
the designation of a certain area contiguous to   
the Initial Area, as more fully described in      
said ordinance (the "Expansion Area") and         
another area, as more fully described in said     
ordinance (the "Satellite Area") as an            
enterprise zone eligible for the tax incentives   
provided by the Statute; and                      
      WHEREAS, the Statute allows, in             
certain circumstances and subject to certain      
conditions, the ad valorem taxes which would      
otherwise be due on subsequent                    
improvements made in enterprise zone areas        
to be abated up to 100% for a period not to       
exceed 25 years from the date the original        
enterprise zone area was so designated; for       
any such subsequent improvements begun            
prior to August 28, 1991; and                     
     WHEREAS , the Initial Area was               
designated as an enterprise zone in 1983 and      
the Expansion Area and Satellite Area have        
both been designated as an enterprise zone;       
and                                               
      WHEREAS , Ordinance No. 62886               
provides for abatement of taxes on real           
property in the Initial Area, Expansion Area      
and Satellite Area (hereinafter, together         
referred to as the "Areas") in accordance with    
the requirements of Section 135.215 of the        
Statute, as amended from time to time, subject    
to certain terms and conditions; and              
      WHEREAS , Ordinance No. 62886               
provides for the Land Clearance for               
Redevelopment Authority of the City of St.        
Louis ("LCRA") to review plans for                
subsequent improvements on real property          
in the Areas and to recommend to this Board       
the extent to which tax abatement should be       
granted therefor; and                             
      WHEREAS , Drew Wojcik Photography           
is renovating the building for a studio/gallery;  
and                                               
     WHEREAS , it is estimated that the           
subsequent improvements will cost                 
approximately $154,000; and will result in an     
increase of 2 new jobs; and                       
      WHEREAS , LCRA has reviewed plans           
for its subsequent improvements and               
recommends that the ad valorem taxes that         
would otherwise be imposed on, subsequent         
improvements be abated fully for a period of      
ten (10 ) years; and                              
    WHEREAS , Drew Wojcik Photography             
began the subsequent improvements after           
August 28, 1992; and                              
     WHEREAS, Section 135.215 of the              
Statute provides that no abatement shall be       
 granted except upon approval of an                   
 authorizing resolution by the governing              
 authority having jurisdiction over the               
 enterprise zone area following a public hearing      
 held by said governing authority for the             
 purpose of obtaining the opinions and                
 suggestions of residents of political subdivision    
 in the area affected and published in a              
 newspaper of general circulation in the area to      
 be affected by the exemption at least twenty         
 (20) days prior to the hearing but not more          
 than thirty (30) days prior to the hearing,          
 stating the time, location, date and purpose of      
 the hearing; and                                     
       WHEREAS , such public hearing was              
 held on the ______ day of ____________,              
 2002, notice of which was given in accordance        
 with the requirements of the Statutes as             
 described above, and all interested parties had      
 the opportunity to be heard at said public           
 hearing.                                             
       NOW, THEREFORE, be it resolved by              
 the St. Louis Board of Aldermen as follows:          
       1. The Subsequent Improvements shall           
 be fully exempt from the ad valorem taxes,           
 which would otherwise be imposed thereon             
 for a period of ten years.                           
       2. For purposes of calculating the tax         
 liability for the Subsequent Improvements,           
 any increase in the assessment of any                
 improvements January 1, 2002, from the               
 assessment in effect for such improvements           
 as of January 1, 2002, shall be deemed               
 attributable to the Subsequent Improvements.         
       3. In accordance with Section 135.215(1)       
 of the Statute, a copy of this resolution shall      
 be forwarded to the Director of Missouri             
 Department of Economic Development within            
 thirty (30) days of its approval.                    
 Introduced this __ day of _____, 2002 by:            
 Honorable April Ford-Griffin, Alderwoman 5th Ward    
      Mr. Clay introduced Resolution No. 154          
 and the Clerk was instructed to read same.           
            Resolution No. 154                        
       WHEREAS, we pause in our                       
 deliberations to recognize and honor Alice           
 Stanley who served the citizens of this city in      
 a variety of capacities for more than twenty         
 years; and                                           
       WHEREAS, Alice, who was born and               
 raised in the City of St. Louis, is a distinguished  
 graduate of Soldan High School and holds             
 degrees from both St. Louis University and           
 Washington University; and                           
      WHEREAS, in 1979 began her career in            
 public service as an Accountant I for the            
 Community Development Agency; and                    
       WHEREAS, as an invaluable public          
 servant Alice served as an Accounting Manager   
 for the Community Development Agency; as        
 an Accounting Manager and Fiscal Manager        
 in the Office of the Comptroller and as a Fiscal
 Officer for the City Health Department; and     
      WHEREAS, in addition to the many long      
 hours devoted to the work of the City           
 government, Alice finds time to volunteer her   
 talents to support the valuable work of the     
 Girls Scouts Council of Greater St. Louis,      
 United Way of Greater St. Louis, the St. Louis  
 Chapter of the NAACP and the St. Louis          
 University Black Alumni Association; and        
       WHEREAS, Alice is an exceptional          
 member of our community whose service to        
 all of our citizens is greatly appreciated;     
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis that we pause to          
 recognize and thank Alice Stanley for her       
 dedication and service to the City of St. Louis 
 and we further direct the Clerk of this Board   
 to spread a copy of this Resolution across the  
 minutes of these proceedings and to prepare a   
 commemorative copy to the end that it may       
 be presented to our honoree at a time and       
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.        
 Introduced on the 13th day of September, 2002   
 by:                                             
 Honorable Irving Clay, Jr. , Alderman 26th Ward 
      Unanimous consent having been              
 obtained Resolution No. 154 stood               
 considered.                                     
      Mr. Clay moved that Resolution No. 154     
 be adopted, at this meeting of the Board.       
      Seconded by Ms. Tyus.                      
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.         
      Due to the absence of the Sponsor,         
 Resolution No. 157 was placed on the informal   
 calendar.                                       
           SECOND READING                        
           OF RESOLUTIONS                        
      None.                                      
        MISCELLANEOUS AND                        
        UNFINISHED BUSINESS                      
      None.                                      
           ANNOUNCEMENTS                         
      None.                                      
         EXCUSED ALDERMEN                        
      Mr. Wessels moved to excuse the            
 following aldermen due to their necessary       
 absence: Mr. Bosley, Ms. Young, Mr. Schmid      
      Seconded by Mr. Villa.                     
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.         
            ADJOURNMENT                         
      Mr. Wessels moved to adjourn under        
rules to return Friday, September 24, 2002.     
     Seconded by Mr. Villa.                     
     Carried unanimously by voice vote.         
     Respectfully submitted,                    
     Fred F. Steffen, Clerk                     
     Board of Aldermen                          
  BOARD OF                                      
PUBLIC SERVICE                                  
 St. Louis, MO - September 17, 2002             
     Board met at 1:45 P.M.                     
    Present: Directors, Siedhoff, Thomas,       
Bushmeyer and President Hearst.                 
     Absent:      Directors Visintainer,        
Suelmann, Bess and Griggs (excused)             
      Requests of the Director of Public        
Utilities to be excused from the Regular        
Meeting of September 17 and 24, 2002            
designating Mr. James Kummer to act in his      
behalf; Director of Streets designating Mr.     
Stephen Runde to act in his behalf; Director    
of Parks, Recreation and Forestry designating   
Mrs. Karen Pecaut to act in his behalf, and;    
Director of Airport to be excused from the      
Regular Meeting of September 17, 2002 were      
received and leaves of absence granted.         
     Minutes of the Regular Meeting of          
September 10, 2002 were unanimously             
approved.                                       
     The following documents were referred      
by the Secretary:                               
         September 16, 2002

                  LETTINGS                          
       Three sealed proposals for the public        
 work advertised under Letting No. 8188 -           
 Miscellaneous Civil Construction at Lambert;       
 Three under Letting No. 8189 - Miscellaneous       
 Mechanical Construction at Lambert, and;           
 Four under Letting No. 8191 - Wheelchair           
 Ramp Installation Program, Project No. WRP-        
 16, were received, publicly opened, read and       
 referred to the President.                         
      Communications, reports, recommend-           
 ations and documents were submitted by             
 Board Members and action thereon taken as          
 follows:                                           
                 PRESIDENT                          
      Preliminary approval ordered given and        
 10 days granted in which to sign same:             
      Letting No. 8181 - Concrete and Brick      
 Removal/Replacement and Complete                
 Sidewalk Installation, Project No. SP-53, Stika 
 Concrete Co., Inc., 10703 Tesshire Dr., St.     
 Louis, MO 63123, Amount: $569,969.50            
      Design/Build Services for Cypress          
 Parking Facility, Lambert, R.G. Brinkmann       
 Construction Co., 16650 Chesterfield Grove      
 Road, Suite 100, Chesterfield, MO 63005,        
 Amount: $10,922,712.                            
       Addendum No. 2 to the plans and           
 specifications for Letting No. 8186 - Grattan   
 Street Parkway - Phase I approved and made      
 part of the original plans.                     
      Addendum No. 1 to the plans and            
 specifications for Letting No. 8190 -           
 Miscellaneous Electric Construction at          
 Lambert approved and made part of the           
 original plans.                                 
      Addendum No. 1 to the plans and            
 specifications for Letting No. 8192 -           
 Residential Sound Insulation Program Part       
 XVII at Lambert approved and made part of       
 the original plans.                             
      All bids ordered rejected for Letting No.  
 8180 - 2002/2003 Floor Replacement for          
 Public Portions of C, D, and E International    
 Gate Areas and East Connector at Lambert,       
 by reason of the fact that the two bids received
 were in excess of funds available for this      
 project.                                        
      Supplemental Agreement No. 26 to           
 P.S.A. 846 with Sverdrup Corp., for Design      
 Services for the Reconstruction of the Eads     
 Bridge Highway Deck approved and President      
 authorized to execute same.

 Soil Boring, Sampling and Lab testing at        
 Lambert approved and President authorized

 for Geotechnical and Foundations Engineering    
 Services at Lambert approved and President      
 authorized to execute same.

 Construction Quality Assurance Survey and       
 Quantity Measurement Survey Services at         
 Lambert approved and President authorized       
 to execute same.

 Associates, Inc., for Design Services for New   
 Community Center - South St. Louis              
 approved and President authorized to execute    
 same.

Associates, for Architectural Acoustical         
Engineering and Program Management

Lambert approved and President authorized        
to execute same.

Dinettes at Lambert.

                  President                         
 ATTEST:                                            
                  Darlene A. Plump,                 
                  Secretary                         
           Office of the Board                      
           of Public Service                        
            City of St. Louis                       
       Sealed Proposals will be received for the    
 Public Work hereinafter mentioned at the           
 Office of the Board of Public Service,             
 Room 208, City Hall, until 1:45 p.m.,              
 October 1, 2002, St. Louis, Missouri time, at      
 which time whey will be publicly opened and        
 read, viz:                                         
 Letting No. 8193: Lambert-St. Louis                
 International Airport Expansion Program            
 group No. 2 - Residential Asbestos Abatement       
 Services                                           
 Deposit: $44,335.00                                
       The bid package will be available for        
 purchase from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday       
 through Friday commencing September 3,             
 2002, through INDOX Services, One                  
 Document Drive, St. Louis, MO 63114                
 (Phone: 314-810-5900) upon payment of              
 $10.00 plus shipping, if required. Purchased       
 sets become the property of the prospective        
 bidder and no refunds will be made.                
      A pre-bid conference will be held at          
 3:30 p.m., September 10, 2002, at the Airport      
 Program Management Office, Conference              
 Room A, Riverport Lakes East, 13723                
 Riverport Drive, Maryland Heights, MO              
 63043.                                             
       Proposals must be made on blank forms        
 to be furnished by the President of the Board      
 of Public Service, and must be submitted to        
 Room 208, City Hall.                               
       Each bidder shall specify in its proposal    
 in figures, without interlineations, alternations  
 or erasures, a unit price for each of those items  
 where so called for in the proposal, and shall     
 show the products of the respective unit prices    
 and estimated quantities. And show, in             
 addition thereto, at the end of the bid the Total  
 Bid Amount for which he will perform all of        
 the estimated work as requested by the general     
 requirements and covenants and                     
 specifications.                                    
       In case of a discrepancy between the         
 gross sum shown in the proposal and that           
 obtained by the addition of each item, the latter  
 shall prevail.                                     
      Each bid must be accompanied by a           
 Cashier's or Treasurer's Check of a Bank or      
 Trust Company in the City of St. Louis,          
 payable to the order of the City Treasurer, or   
 a Surety Bond approved by the Comptroller        
 of the City of St. Louis for the amount of       
 Deposit required, as heretofore stated.          
       All work under this contract will be paid  
 for in cash, based on monthly estimates of the   
 work completed, less a retained amount of        
 5%. Final Payment, including all retained        
 percentages, will be made within ten (10) days   
 after completion of all work and final           
 acceptance by the City.                          
       The City of St. Louis will affirmatively   
 insure that in any contract entered into         
 pursuant to this advertisement, fully certified  
 Disadvantaged Business Enterprises will be       
 afforded full opportunity to submit bids in      
 response to this invitation and will not be      
 discriminated against on the grounds of race,    
 color or national origin in consideration for an 
 award. The Disadvantaged Business                
 Enterprise goal for this project is 30%.         
       The contract shall provide that not less   
 than the prevailing hourly rate of wages in the  
 City of St. Louis as determined by the           
 Department of Labor and Industrial Relations     
 of the State of Missouri for each craft or type  
 of workmen needed in the actual work on the      
 site herein authorized, as well as the general   
 prevailing rate for legal holiday and overtime   
 work shall be paid to all workmen.               
      All labor to be performed under this        
 contract shall be subject to the provisions of   
 Sections 290.210 to 290.340 inclusive, of the    
 Revised Statues of Missouri, 1986.               
       The right of the Board of Public Service   
 to reject any or all bids is expressly reserved. 
    By order of the Board of Public Service,      
 AUGUST 27, 2002.                                 
                  Ronald A. Hearst, P.E.          
                  President                       
 ATTEST:                                          
                  Darlene A. Plump,               
                  Secretary                       
    PUBLIC NOTICE                                 
      A public hearing will be held by the        
 Board of Adjustment at 1:30 p.m. on              
 Wednesday, September 25, 2002, in Room 208       
 City Hall to consider the following:             
       APPEAL 8095 - Appeal filed by              
 Restaurant 079 Pizza, from the determination     
 of the Building Commissioner in the denial of    
 a building permit authorizing the Appellant      
 to do interior and exterior alterations per plans
 to operate a pizza restaurant at 4907            
 Devonshire. Ward 14 #AB250320-02                 
      APPEAL 8096 - Appeal filed by St. Louis   
Charter Academies, Inc., from the               
determination of the Building Commissioner      
in the denial of an occupancy permit            
authorizing the Appellant to operate an office  
for the school administration at 5223 N. 20th   
Street. Ward 3 #AO252939-02                     
     APPEAL 8097 - Appeal filed by Cora         
Lee Poe, from the determination of the          
Building Commissioner in the denial of a home   
occupancy waiver authorizing the Appellant      
to operate a home day care for 10 children at   
6001 Shulte Ave. Ward 27 Home Occupancy         
Waiver                                          
     APPEAL 8098 - Appeal filed by AJH          
Housing, Inc., from the determination of the    
Building Commissioner in the denial of an       
occupancy permit authorizing the Appellant      
to operate an office and classroom              
(homeowners classes) at 3965 Delor.             
Ward 14 #AO254820-02                            
     In accordance with the provisions of       
Ordinance 59981, effective July 31, 1986.       
    By authority of the Board of                
Adjustment.                                     
     E. Smoot, Chairman

                NOTICE OF                     
  OPEN MEETING                                
       HUMAN DEVELOPMENT                      
          CORPORATION                         
      Notice is hereby given that the HUMAN   
 DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION OF                   
 METROPOLITAN ST. LOUIS WILL                  
 CONDUCT A MEETING AT 12:00 NOON,             
 ON FRIDAY SEPTEMBER 27, 2002 AT              
 935 N. VANDEVENTER, ST. LOUIS, MO            
 A tentative agenda of the meeting includes:  
 1.   Roll Call of Members Present            
 2.   Review of Minutes of the                
      August 30, 2002 Meeting                 
 3.   Correspondence                          
 4.   Reports                                 
      a) Nominating Committee Report          
      b) Chairman's Report                    
      c) Budget and Audit Committee Report    
      d) Executive Director's Report          
 5.   Old Business                            
 6.   New Business                            
      Representatives of the news media may   
 obtain copies of this notice by contacting:  
      Mrs. Ruth A. Smith                      
      929 North Spring Avenue                 
      St. Louis, MO 63108                     
      (314) 613-2200                          
      REQUEST FOR                             
 QUALIFICATIONS                               
       The City of St. Louis Department of    
 Public Safety, Neighborhood Stabilization    
 Team is seeking experienced agencies,        
 institutions or professionals for contract   
 services to evaluate the effectiveness of the
 Juvenile Accountability Incentive Block      
 Grant, coordinated enforcement plan for the  
 City of St. Louis, to be provided to youth   
 who are under the supervison of the Family   
 Court, 22nd Judicial Circuit. $35,000 is     
available for an evaluation contract for the       
period October 1, 2002 through                     
September 30, 2003. Agencies, institutions         
or other professionals who wish to be              
considered for this contract services              
opportunity must submit a letter of interest       
and qualifications for providing the evaluation    
by 5:00 p.m. Friday, September 27, 2002 to         
the address listed below. Prospective agencies,    
institutions or other professionals who are        
considered responsive to this request for          
qualifications will be scheduled at a later date   
to provide a brief presentation relative to their  
experience and qualifications before a City of     
St. Louis review panel in accordance with the      
rules and procedures for Professional Service      
Agreements, City Ordinance 64102 and               
64103.                                             
     Submit letters to:                            
     Department of Public Safety                   
     Neighborhood Stabilization Team               
     Bill Flowers                                  
     Program Manager                               
     634 N. Grand, Room 723                        
     St. Louis, Mo 63103                           
     REQUEST FOR                                   
       PROPOSAL                                    
      The Department of Personnel of the City      
of St. Louis is soliciting proposals from          
qualified organizations to conduct Diversity       
Training for City employees. A Request for         
Proposal may be secured from the City of           
St. Louis, Personnel Department, Employee          
Development Section, 1114 Market,                  
Suite 913, St. Louis, MO 63103, 622-5763.          
     SUBMIT PROPOSALS TO:                          
     Edmund Knowles                                
     Manager, Employee Development                 
     City of St. Louis,                            
     Department of Personnel                       
     1114 Market Street, Suite 913                 
     314-622-5763                                  
     Fax: 314-622-4810                             
      THE DEADLINE FOR RECEIVING                   
PROPOSALS has been extended to                     
12:00 Noon, October 17, 2002. Five copies          
of each proposal (one copy for each committee      
person) should be included in the bid package.     
       The deadline for questions (in writing,     
please) is 12:00 Noon, October 3, 2002.            
Answers to all questions will be shared with       
all firms solicited and/or requesting the RFP.     
 INVITATION TO BID                                 
  Board of Police Commissioners                    
  Metropolitan Police Department                   
     City of St. Louis, Missouri                   
 Bid #4-033441 Forensic Crime Scene                
               Reconstruction Software             
               and Equipment                       
               (Re-advertisement)                  
       Sealed bids for the above will be received  
 at the St. Louis Metropolitan Police              
 Department, Office of the Director of             
 Purchasing, 1200 Clark Avenue, Room 605,          
 St. Louis, Missouri 63103, until 11:00 a.m.       
 local time, Friday, October 4, 2002, when         
 they will be opened publicly and announced.       
       Official bid forms on which bids must       
 be submitted may be obtained from the Office      
 of the Director of Purchasing by prospective      
 bidders upon request in person or by              
 telephone during regular business hours.          
       Contractor shall not discriminate in        
 matters of employment, upgrading, transfer,       
 rates of pay selection or otherwise, against      
 any employee or applicant for employment          
 because of race, creed, color, sex or national    
 origin. Noncompliance shall be sufficient         
 cause to reject any bid or terminate the          
 contract, and the Board of Police                 
 Commissioners of the St. Louis Metropolitan       
 Police Department shall be entitled to recover    
 any damages resulting from termination.           
       The Board of Police Commissioners           
 reserves the right to waive any formalities and   
 to reject any and all bids. The Board also        
 reserves the right to consider criteria other     
 than the low bid in the award of a contract.      
 Among other factors, the Board will consider      
 the location of the business, minority interest   
 in the business, prior performance and the bid    
 submitted in relation to the needs of the St.     
 Louis Metropolitan Police Department.             
      CAROL GRASSI                                 
      DIRECTOR OF PURCHASING                       
      PHONE # 314-444-5608                         
            DEPARTMENT OF                          
      PERSONNEL                                    
     NOTICE OF EXAMINATIONS                        
      The Department of Personnel, Room            
 100 City Hall, City of St. Louis, Missouri,       
 announces competitive Civil Service               
 examinations to fill vacancies in the Municipal   
 Service.                                          
 The last date for filing an application for the 
 following examination is OCTOBER 11, 2002       
          MICROCOMPUTER                          
        SUPPORT SPECIALIST                       
             Prom./O.C. 8858                     
 $26,962 to $40,456 (Annual Salary Range)        
 The last date for filing an application for the 
 following examination is OCTOBER 18, 2002       
       TELECOMMUNICATOR                          
  (AIRPORT POLICE DISPATCHER)                    
             Prom./O.C. 8859                     
 $24,726 to $37,102 (Annual Salary Range)        
      Vacation, Holidays, Sick Leave, Social     
 Security, and Employee Retirement System        
 Benefit privileges are provided in addition to  
 salary.                                         
      Application forms and further              
 information concerning duties of positions,     
 desirable and necessary qualifications, relative
 weights of examination components, and          
 duration of eligible lists may be secured in the
 office of the Department of Personnel, Room     
 100 City Hall. Applications can be submitted    
 on the Internet. Visit the city web site        
 (www.stlouiscity.com) and link to Jobs with     
 the City of St. Louis.                          
                  William C. Duffe, Director     
 SEPTEMBER 18, 2002                              
 NOTICE TO ALL BIDDERS                           
      CITY ORDINANCE requires that any           
 individual or company who performs work         
 within the City limits must obtain a Business   
 License. This would also apply to businesses    
 who employ sales or delivery personnel to       
 come into the City. Contracts requiring work    
 to be performed in the City will NOT be         
 awarded to unlicensed businesses.               
 Please contact the License Collector, Room      
 104 City Hall, St. Louis, Missouri, 63103 or    
 phone (314) 622-4528. You may also refer to     
 our on-line site at www.stlouiscity.com.        
    SUPPLY                                       
 COMMISSIONER                                    
 Office of the Supply Commissioner,              
 Room 324, City Hall, 1200 Market Street,        
 St. Louis, Missouri 63103, Tuesday,             
 September 24, 2002 - ADVERTISED BIDS            
 will be received by the undersigned to be       
 opened at the office at 12:00 o'clock noon, for 
 the items listed below on the dates specified.  
       Notice to All Suppliers                   
      NOTE: It is the policy of the City of St.  
Louis that all firms desiring to do business     
with the City of St. Louis must comply with      
employment practices that are in accordance      
with the ordinances of the City of St. Louis     
and the Mayor's Executive Order promulgated      
there-under to the end that all Contractors      
and suppliers of materials and services will     
offer equal opportunity for employment and       
job advancement to blacks and other minority     
groups in the St. Louis Metropolitan area.       
   THURSDAY, OCTOBER 3, 2002                     
       MISCELLANEOUS AIDS

  METAL CLAD/ALUMINUM CABLE                    
 for furnishing the Airport Authority per

         UNINTERUPTED                          
      POWER SUPPLY SYSTEM                      
 for furnishing the Airport Authority per      
 Req. #162.                                    
      Bidders are invited to be present at the 
 opening of bids. Bid results may be available 
 30 days following the date of bid opening. If 
 you desire bid results, please include a self-
 address, stamped envelope with your bid.      
      The City of St. Louis desires to         
 purchase recycled products whenever           
 possible, especially items containing post    
 consumer waste materials. If your company     
 can supply recycled products, please provide  
 information to this office.                   
      The right to reject any and all bids is  
 reserved.                                     
                 Freddie L. Dunlap             
                 Supply Commissioner           
                 (314) 622-4580                
                 www.stlouis.missouri.org
